Danube School on Instrumentation in Elementary Particle & Nuclear Physics University of Novi Sad, Serbia, September 8th-13th, 2014.

Aim of school

The aim of school is to bring together graduate students from universities from whole Danube region and also Worldwide. The school is an equal opportunity intended for MSc, PhD students and postdocs who want to aquire "hands-on" experience in different detector technologies used in particle and nuclear physics.

Register »

Scope

The ICFA schools started in 1987 at the International Center of Theoretical Physics (ICTP) of Trieste. The aim of the school was to share the expertise in new detector technologies with physicists from less developed countries guests of the ITCP. After that very positive experience, reproduced in 1989 again in Trieste, the school started to be organized abroad, in sites located outside the highly industrialized parts of the world.

Venue

The University of Novi Sad is a contemporary educational, scientific and art institution, with around 50 thousands students at three levels of studies and 3,500 teaching staff at 350 study programmes. For many years the University has been intensively developing international cooperation with universities and other institutions in the area of higher education, scientific and research activities from Europe and the world. It has presided over the Danube Rectors’ Conference in 2010 and is a member of many other international organizations, such as the European University Association, European University Foundation, Balkan Universities Network, the Alpe Adria Initiative Universities’ Network etc...
